g.text: papillae (large club-shaped cells) were observed in the basal floor of the gemma cup
D). The elongated morphology of mucilage papillae was distinct, with a
number of single-membrane vesicles in their cytosol (Figure S1C). At the initial stage of
gemma development, the basal stalk cell was already vacuolated, and the apical gemma cell
underwent several rounds of periclinal cell divisions. In most cases, an anticlinal cell
division was observed in the basal floor cell attached to the early stage of the developing
gemma, while there was no cell division observed in the basal floor cell attached to the
has been exploited as a basal plant model system due to the
availability of whole-genome sequence information, high-efficiency transformation
To identify key regulator(s) involved in the initial stage of gemma development in
, we focused on two mutants, named
), that show a common phenotype of impaired gemma formation. These two mutants
was isolated during the screening of T-DNA-tagged
lines for morphological phenotypes of the gametophyte thallus [17], and
from transgenic lines generated by biolistic delivery of a plasmid [18]. In the wild type as
mutants, gemma cups formed at intervals on the dorsal side of
thalli along the midrib (Figure 1A, B, and C). Numerous mature gemmae were observed
from the top of the wild-type gemma cup; however, no gemmae were found in the
mutants (Figure 1F, G, and H). Transverse sections of the gemma cup showed no
developing gemmae in the gemma-cup of the
